entry.title: Habitat
entry.content:
Watch Now

Join us for a discussion about Habitat a new approach to automation that focuses on the application instead of the infrastructure it runs on. With Habitat, the apps you build, deploy, and manage behave consistently in any runtime — metal, VMs, containers, and PaaS. You'll spend less time on the environment and more time building features.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

entry.content:
Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline

  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Ben Rockwood twitter, blog, github
  • Jeff Sussna twitter, website
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

What's Cooking? - Chef News & Events

  • Webinars:
    • Chef DOJO: Your DevOps Journey Assessment
    • Test Driven Cookbook Development - February 24
    • Chef Workflow - March 9
  • Upcoming Chef Training
    • Chef Essentials
      • Chicago
      • Toronto
      • San Francisco
      • Atlanta
      • Online
    • Chef Intermediate Topics
      • Chicago
      • Seattle
      • Atlanta
      • Online
    • Test-driven Cookbook Development - New offering
      • Online
  • From the Chef Blog
    • 7 Ways IT Will Change in 2016 to Bring DevOps Mainstream
    • Update on native 64-bit Windows Chef Client
    • Delivery’s Bitbucket (Stash) Integration Released
    • Supermarket 2.3.3 Release
    • Chef Server 12.4.1 Release
    • Chef Compliance 0.10.4 Release
    • Chef Management Console 2.1.2 Security Release
    • Chef Reporting Release 1.5.6
    • Notes from the Lab: What’s Keeping Marginalized Groups Out of Tech?
  • New on LearnChef
    • Transformation at Gannett in the Skills Library
  • New on the supermarket
    • Recent Cookbooks
      • nginx_server v1.0.1
      • docker v2.4.12
      • artifactory-artifact v0.2.0
      • prun-cfg v0.2.25 (PostgreSQL / Ruby on Rails/ Ubuntu / Nginx)
      • telegraf v0.3.3
      • os_floating_lo v0.1.2
      • bacula-backup v1.10.2
      • jetty v0.4.1 - Deprecated
      • sqlite v1.1.3 - Deprecated
      • sensu-handlers v0.1.7
      • Follow @getgetchef on twitter for more cookbook updates.
    • Recent Tools and Plugins
      • Reagan - Ruby Jenkins build script that automates the testing of individual items in a monolithic chef-repo.
      • kitchen-chef-extended-attributes - Kitchen Driver that allows you to use test-kitchen with chef-solo - and automatically link suites to the same named JSON dna file to ensure your node specification doesn't drift from your test definition.
      • /tmp Compliance Profile - An example compliance profile built with InSpec
      • Rubymine Chef Configs - Rubymine configurations for Chef
  • Upcoming Events
    • ChefConf 2016 - July 11-13 in Austin, Texas. CFP and ticket sales are now open.
    • DevOpsDays
      • Vancouver - April 15-16
      • London - April 19-20
      • Rockies/Denver - April 21-22
      • Atlanta - April 26-27
      • Austin - May 2-3
      • Kiel - May 12-13
      • Seattle - May 12-13
      • Toronto - May 26-27
      • Washington, DC - June 8-9
      • Salt Lake City - June 14-15
      • Amsterdam - June 29 - July 1
      • Minneapolis - July 20-21

Show Notes

  • We should do a @foodfightshow about DevOps & Design Thinking with @jeffsussna; clearly several of us are thinking about it!
  • What is Design Thinking?
  • Design Thinking compared to Lean Concepts, DevOps, and Agile
  • How does it inform the practice of building & operating high velocity organizations?
  • Design Thinking
  • TPS: Toyota Production System
  • A3 Template
    • Developing a Learning Culture: Intro to the Personal A3 Template
  • Abduction
  • Implementation: "What is it you actually want to do?"
  • Design Thinking Workshops
    • Designing Delivery: Rethinking IT in the Digital Service Economy
  • Design Thinking Resources
    • Change by Design: How Design Thinking Transforms Organizations and Inspires Innovation
    • This is Service Design Thinking
    • Japanese Terms For DevOps Practitioners
    • DevOps Demystified

Picks

Jeff Sussna

  • Hippie Modernism: The Struggle for Utopia

Brandon

  • Towards an understanding of technical debt
  • The Principles of Product Development Flow: Second Generation Lean Product Development

Nathen

  • ChefConf
  • DevOpsDays DC

entry.content:
Watch Now

Panel

  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Matt Ray github, twitter, irc: mattray, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • John Vincent, aka Lusis twitter, github
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter

Outline

  • How The Food Fight Show got started
  • Favorite Episodes:
    • Testing in Practice
    • Back to the Kernel With Greg Kroah-Hartman
    • TESTALLTHETHINGS: Testing Infrastructure with Jim Hopp, Stephen Nelson-Smith, and Andrew Crump
    • Live Post-Mortem With David Zwieback, John Allspaw, and Mike Rembetsy
    • Adrian Cockcroft Episode => Netflix OSS
    • Steven Murawski Episode => Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins
    • Nordstrom Episode => Windows Roundtable
    • Live Episodes
    • LWRPs
    • Application Deployment
    • Continuous Delivery
  • What has gotten better in the DevOps community since the show started?
    • Diversity
    • The rise of "Small Town" DevOps Days
  • The DevOps Debate
    • "DevOps" across the industry
    • WHAT DOES "DEVOPS" MEAN?!?!?!
    • Improving knowledge
    • Continuous improvement: The new "CI"
    • Gene Kim (Twitter)
  • Grievances
    • Priveledge, Flexibility, & Time
    • The passing of James Golick, Ezra Zygmuntowicz, and Jim Weirich
    • Linux is becoming dominant
    • OpenStack
    • "Working Code Builds Consensus" -- Jesse Robins
    • Neglecting the humanity: We are PEOPLE too!
    • No managers?

Picks

Brandon

  • Jon Cowie: Remote Working: 3 Year Retrospective

Nathen

  • Start
    • scheduling more regular Food Fight Show episodes
    • Have a Book Club series: POODR: Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby: An Agile Primer by Sandi Metz.
  • Stop
    • having panels that are all white men.
  • Continue
    • Having discussions about technology.
    • doing Chef-specific episodes.

Matt

  • SoftwareDefinedTalk
  • The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon
  • Your Local Library

John

  • Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K750

Mike

  • Ready Player One by Ernest Cline

Bryan

  • The Click Library from Python
  • airline
  • Java 8
  • Nathen Harvey

lusis

  • Model View Culture: Alcohol and Inclusivity: Planning Tech Events with Non-Alcoholic Options
  • Betraying The Martyrs - Let It Go (Official Music Video) \m/

Nathen

  • Not hotel wifi

Dan

  • A challenge to everyone involved in organising tech events: how can we leverage our many social gatherings for the greater social good? For example, consider the 1:1:1 model in the context of tech events, or even something as simple as donating some of the profits to charity (perhaps to build a well).

Seth

  • Consul Template, announcement, github
  • CPOSC, especially Charlie Reisinger's DevOps is Cool for Schools
  • Write in Go (song/video)

Brandon

  • OS X 10.10 Yosemite: The Ars Technica Review by John Siracusa
